channel.title: Need some Advice?
channel.description:
Okay, Recently I decided to work on a server status for my community.
This was originally worked on for Cody (Aka The Reaper X) Anyway, I need your advice, try it out, see if it works. Tell me your opinion.
[url=http://www.jakiel-networks.com/ss/Server_Status.php]Click[/url]
Tell me what I need to add, give me a design, ect.
Thanks Taharok for Approving this thread.

item.title: Need some Advice?
item.dc:creator: @P_I_M_P_3_D_Tut `Lewk_
item.description:
@P_I_M_P_3_D_Tut wrote:

[quote=“lesterknome, post:9, topic:307337”][quote author=Cowie` link=topic=403489.msg2987901#msg2987901 date=1255127677]

Java Applet to Register the server always = win.

Check the one i made to see the bytes to send, if you know please tell me so i know if i’m right or not

'Xcept if people are smart they wouldn’t trust a random applet by a random person because THEY COULD PUT A DROPPER IN IT.

[/quote]

I trust lewk. Comodo <3[/quote]
I think he was talking about trusting someone with a Java applet…

Read full topic

item.title: Need some Advice?
item.dc:creator: @lesterknome lesterknome
item.description:
@lesterknome wrote:

[quote=“Cowie`, post:8, topic:307337”][quote author=lesterknome link=topic=403489.msg2987799#msg2987799 date=1255123326]
Java Applet to Register the server always = win.

Check the one i made to see the bytes to send, if you know please tell me so i know if i’m right or not
[/quote]

'Xcept if people are smart they wouldn’t trust a random applet by a random person because THEY COULD PUT A DROPPER IN IT.[/quote]

I trust lewk. Comodo <3[br][br][size=1]Posted on: October 09, 2009, 09:39:59 pm[/size][hr][quote=“Si Force, post:5, topic:307337”]A server description on the registration page wouldn’t be too much to ask for, I would mention SQL Injections but it seems that Taharok has already done so.[/quote]
Another reason for An applet.

Read full topic

item.title: Need some Advice?
item.dc:creator: @primadude Primadude
item.description:
@primadude wrote:

[quote=“lesterknome, post:6, topic:307337”][quote author=Si Force link=topic=403489.msg2987833#msg2987833 date=1255124494]
A server description on the registration page wouldn’t be too much to ask for, I would mention SQL Injections but it seems that Taharok has already done so.
[/quote]

SQL injections?[/quote]

en.wikipedia.org

SQL injection

SQL injection is a code injection technique, used to attack data-driven applications, in which nefarious SQL statements are inserted into an entry field for execution (e.g. to dump the database contents to the attacker). SQL injection must exploit a security vulnerability in an application's software, for example, when user input is either incorrectly filtered for string literal escape characters embedded in SQL statements or user input is not strongly typed and unexpectedly executed. SQL in

Read full topic

item.title: Need some Advice?
item.dc:creator: @P_I_M_P_3_D_Tut `Lewk_
item.description:
@P_I_M_P_3_D_Tut wrote:

Taharok:

I suggest you hide the link. And, if you use a SQL server to store the information, do you protect the page from possible SQL injections?

Yes, of course.

[quote=“lesterknome, post:3, topic:307337”]Java Applet to Register the server always = win.

Check the one i made to see the bytes to send, if you know please tell me so i know if i’m right or not :P[/quote]
I haven’t seen it,
PM me it or get on IRC

Read full topic
